result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael Guerrero

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Michael Guerrero not in court, in custody, appearance waived.  Attorney William Anthony Rakestraw Ii in court for Michael Guerrero.  Attorney Abby Rockendorf in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for Scheduling conference. Defense has received an offer from the State.  There is a possible global resolution with Case 21CF5281 before Br. 2 with Plea and Sentencing set for 12/14/2022 at 1:30 pm.  Court finds good cause to adjourn this matter for plea and sentencing hearing in Br. 9 pending global resolution with Br. 2. Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 14, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Michael Guerrero not in court, in custody, appearance waived.  Attorney William Anthony Rakestraw in court for Michael Guerrero.  Attorney Francesco Mineo in court for the State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for Scheduling Conference. Defense has received discovery, but is awaiting an offer from the State and requests adjourned Scheduling Conference.  Request granted.  Case adjourned to Br. 9.
Scheduling conference scheduled for October 19, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Michael Guerrero in court with attorney William Anthony Rakestraw.  Defendant Michael Guerrero in custody at HOC.  Arthur Kenneth Thexton appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  Michael Guerrero appeared by video means with Attorney.    Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial. Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge VanGrunsven Branch 09.   
Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 09.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 31, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Defendant Michael Guerrero in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Michael Guerrero in custody.  Jacob A. Maule appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Michael Guerrero appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Stark, Branch 17.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that effective 7/30/22, this case is assigned to branch 9, Judge Paul Van Grunsven in room 632 of the Courthouse.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 9, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
